abstracts.cdata!:
When the Nepal Financial Sector
            Restructuring Project (FSRP) was presented to the Board, it
            was agreed that the project team update semi-annually the
            Performance Indicators established as benchmarks, for
            measuring the performance of the two Management Teams which
            have been placed in the two institutions - Nepal Bank
            Limited (NBL) and Rastriya Banijya Bank (RBB). The primary
            function of these Management Teams is to restructure these
            banks and prepare them for privatization. This is the first
            of such reports to be furnished to the Board every six
            months. The indicators are computed using data for the
            six-month period ending mid-July 2004. Performance
            indicators are summarized for each of the two institutions,
            based on eight main themes: Debt recovery; Business and
            revenue growth indicators; Operating efficiency;
            Profitability; Staff Efficiency; Capital Fund;
            Computerization of Branches; and, Disclosure Requirement.
